author: archyde
title: Galaxy Watch7 Now Available: Samsung's Unique Discount Shakes the Market - Smartmania.cz
text:
Samsung’s Galaxy Watch7 Offer: Is Free Really Free? Samsung is making waves in the market with promotions on its latest devices, particularly the Galaxy Watch7. The allure of getting a premium smartwatch “entirely free” is drawing attention, but what’s the catch? Let’s delve into the details of this offer and whether it’s truly a deal worth considering, especially in light of the evolving smartwatch landscape.
The Allure of the Galaxy Ecosystem Samsung positions its smartphones, tablets, smartwatches, and headphones as top-tier choices, emphasizing “the most advanced features, tuned Galaxy AI, premium materials and great design.” The company encourages investment in its entire ecosystem for a seamless user experience. Currently,a discount of up to 15% is available on mobile phones.
Decoding the “Free” Watch Offer The promotion focuses on the Galaxy Watch Ultra and Galaxy Watch7. According to reports, these watches “have been extremely successful,” and are highly-rated by reviewers. The key to unlocking the “free” watch lies in bundled purchases.
Strategic Bundling: Buy More, Save More A key incentive is the “buy more, pay less” strategy.If you’re eyeing the Galaxy S25, using the code “ vicegalaxy ” when purchasing it alongside a Galaxy Watch7 results in a discount of 2,858 CZK. However, the real savings kick in with larger bundles.
Purchasing three or more products simultaneously unlocks a 15% discount. Such as, combining a Samsung Galaxy S25, a Galaxy Tab S10+, and a Galaxy Watch7 yields a savings of 7,840 CZK, effectively making the watch “free.”
Maximizing Savings: Combining Discounts and Bonuses The 15% discount isn’t the only avenue for savings. It can be combined with other benefits and purchase bonuses. According to the promotion, these combinations could potentially save consumers “tens of thousands of crowns.”
Is the Galaxy Watch7 a Good Choice in 2025? The Galaxy Watch7 boasts advanced health tracking features, including continuous heart rate monitoring, sleep analysis, and blood oxygen level detection. its integration with the Samsung ecosystem is seamless, allowing for easy control of your phone, music, and smart home devices. The watch also supports mobile payments and offers a wide range of customizable watch faces.
The Bottom Line: Is It worth It? While the “free” Galaxy Watch7 offer is compelling, it’s essential to assess your needs and budget. If you were already planning to purchase multiple Samsung devices,this promotion offers substantial savings. However,if you are only interested in the watch,consider whether the other bundled items align with your requirements. Always compare prices and consider alternative smartwatches before making a decision.
Ultimately, the value of this promotion depends on your individual circumstances. If you’re a loyal Samsung user looking to upgrade multiple devices,this is an excellent opportunity to save. But remember to do your research and ensure that the “free” watch offer truly aligns with your needs and provides the best overall value.
What are the potential savings offered by samsung’s “buy more, save more” strategy?
Unraveling Samsung’s “Free” Galaxy Watch7 Offer: A Chat with Marketing Expert, Alex Kim Samsung’s latest promotion, offering the Galaxy Watch7 “free” with the purchase of multiple devices, has sparked curiosity and intrigue. To shed some light on this deal and its implications,we sat down with marketing expert Alex Kim.Kim, a regular contributor to tech industry publications, shared his insights into Samsung’s strategy and the appeal of the Galaxy ecosystem.
The allure of the galaxy Ecosystem Alex Kim (AK): Samsung’s approach hinges on positioning its products as the best in their class.From smartphones to smartwatches, they offer advanced features, clever AI, and premium design. The real genius, though, lies in encouraging users to invest in the entire ecosystem for a seamless experience. Currently, they’re offering up to 15% off on mobile phones, sweetening the deal for early adopters.
Decoding the “Free” Watch Offer Archyde (A): Let’s talk about the “free” Galaxy Watch7 offer. How does it work?
AK: Well, the key lies in bundling. Your not really getting a free watch; instead, Samsung is incentivizing you to buy more. The promotion is currently focused on the Galaxy Watch7 and Galaxy Watch Ultra.To qualify, you need to purchase these watches alongside other Samsung devices like smartphones or tablets.
Strategic Bundling: Buy More, Save More A: Can you walk us through the “buy more, save more” strategy?
AK: Sure. If you’re buying the Galaxy S25 with a Galaxy Watch7, you’ll get a discount of around 2,858 CZK. But the real savings come when you bundle three or more products. For instance, combining a Galaxy S25, a Galaxy Tab S10+, and a Galaxy Watch7 can save you up to 7,840 CZK, effectively making the watch “free.” It’s a clever way to boost sales across their product range.
Maximizing Savings: Combining discounts and Bonuses A: Are there other ways to maximize savings with this offer?
AK: Absolutely. Samsung’s promotion allows you to stack discounts and bonuses. By combining different offers, consumers could perhaps save tens of thousands of crowns. It’s like adding a zero to the end of your savings – that’s how notable these bonuses can be.
Is the Galaxy Watch7 a Good Choice in 2025? A: Given the growing smartwatch market,how does the Galaxy Watch7 fare in 2025?
AK: Samsung’s latest smartwatch is packed with advanced health tracking features,seamless ecosystem integration,and mobile payment support. It’s certainly a strong contender. However, with the market expanding and competitors upping their game, it’s definitely not the only option worth considering.
The Bottom Line: Is It worth It? A: So, is Samsung’s “free” Galaxy Watch7 offer a deal worth pursuing?
AK: If you’re planning to upgrade multiple Samsung devices anyway, this promotion can offer ample savings. But remember, it’s critically important to assess your needs and budget. Always compare prices and consider alternative smartwatches. Ultimately, the value of this promotion depends on your individual circumstances.
A: That’s insightful advice, Alex. Our final question is a thought-provoking one: Do you think this bundling strategy will define future tech promotions, or is it a一time deal for Samsung?
AK: I believe bundling is here to stay, especially in the competitive tech landscape. We can expect to see more companies employing this strategy to encourage loyalty and increase sales. However, the intricacies of each promotion will likely vary, making every offer unique.

author: Kyle Gaudette | kgaudette@newburyportnews.com
title: Weekend Roundup: Aylward wins another invitational; locals shine at Frosh-Soph track meet
text:
You can chalk up another wrestling invitational title belt to Douglas Aylward.
After winning the 215-pound championships at both the Big Red Tournament in Tynsborough and the Dan Balboni Holiday Classic in Framingham, the Triton senior wrestled to yet another tournament victory on Saturday. At the Brendan Grant Memorial Tournament in Belmont, Aylward went 3-0 with a pair of pins to claim yet another 215-pound crown.
The No. 1 seed in his weight class, Aylward started his day with a pin over James Agostino of Waltham in the quarterfinals (1:25), then followed with a pin of No. 4 sed Michael Klovski of Lexington in the semis (3:32). That pitted him against No. 2 seed John Gill of Catholic Memorial in the finals, but Aylward dominated his way to a 15-0 major decision in the second period to take home the title belt.
For the season, Aylward is now 19-0 with 17 pins.
But he wasn't the only Viking to make some noise.
Both Alex Sabino and Amir Alami placed fourth, but got there in different ways. Sabino won his 132-pound opener with a pin before falling in the quarterfinals, but made a terrific run to the consolation bracket final. He pinned three straight opponents to make it to the third-place bout, where he did ultimately fall to Belmont's Luke Coelho in a 9-4 decision. Still, it was a solid 4-2 day for Sabino with four pins and a spot on the podium.
On the other hand, Alami won via pin and then by a 4-2 decision to make it to the 165-pound semifinals. He fell to top-seeded Tommy Dicker of Watertown to drop to the consolation bracket, but responed with a win before coming up a tad short in the third-place bout.
Triton's final top-6 placer on the day was Brian Quam, who went 2-2 to take fifth at 138. Sam Imlach went 2-2 and nearly placed at 126, and similarly Nolan Merrill lost his opening match at 175, but responded with three straight wins to finish 3-2 on the day and almost reach the podium.
WISNIEWSKI WINS AT FROSH-SOPH MEET!
The track stars of both today and tomorrow across the state were out in full force for the annual -- and popular -- MSTCA Freshmen-Sophomore Meet down in Boston on Saturday.
And the Newburyport News area was well-represented.
Top among the highlights, however, was Pentucket's Susan Wisniewski. After a terrific cross country season this fall where she was named a Daily News All-Star, the freshman has continued to transition nicely into the winter track season. She competed in the 1000-meter on Saturday, and earned herself a Frosh-Soph Meet title after crossing the finish line first in 3:15.23.
Elsewhere in the girls events, Triton's Colleen Johnson placed ninth in the high jump after clearing 4-6.
On the boys side, there were a handful of notable performances.
The Amesbury young guns had a strong day, with Maxx Rodrigues finishing second in the 600 (1:28.69), Dylan Palen taking third in the shot put (42-5), and the 4x200 relay team of Connor Scialdone, Joseph Puleo, Noah Blouin and Anthony Aguilar-Lopez racing to third in 1:40.02. Newburyport saw Kyle Lisauskas take fourth in the 55 hurdles (8.91), and Triton had Hugo Huang earn a fourth in the high jump (5-6), while Michael Coco took sixth in the 55-meter dash (6.99).
TRITON HOCKEY GETS THREE LATE GOALS
Like the saying goes: Better late than never!
As the clock just dipped under four minutes left in the third period, the Triton boys hockey team trailed North Reading on the road, 3-2. But the Vikings weren't going away quietly, and got three goals over the final 3:59 of the game to sting the Hornets, 5-3, on Saturday.
Colin Fidler scored twice in the victory for the Vikings (4-4-0), and both Josh Hersey and Jack Lindholm had a goal and two assists. Michael Taylor had the final goal while also adding an assist, and Connor Rumph had two helpers as well.
LEANNA GOES BANANAS!
The breakout game for Zayd Leanna can be crossed off the area "to-do" list.
Friday night, the 5-foot-11 sophomore made himself known to the rest of the league, draining three 3s and finishing with 25 points to lead the Newburyport boys basketball team to a 66-48 win over North Reading. Connor Spinney hit a 3 and added 13 points for the Clippers (5-2), and both Finn Brennan and Carson Gretz chipped in 7.
Newburyport will now host Amesbury on Tuesday night.
MARCELIN, ROYALS HELP CAL BAKER ODDS
The Georgetown girls basketball program has always had a nice rivalry with Manchester-Essex over the years, and last season the two shared the CAL Baker championship.
Well, if that's going to be the case again this winter, the Royals helped their title chase out in a big way Friday night.
Led by 10 points on two 3s from senior star Tyrah Marcelin, the Royals went on the road and took down the Hornets, 46-35. Avery Upite hit a pair of 3s and finished with 8 points -- as did Talya Mariani and Katie Davies -- and Neiylah Marcelin chipped in 7 points as well.

author: malvern-online.com
title: LOVE ROCKS ART: The 10th International Youth Art Exhibition and Ars Longa Award Ceremony Exploring Art, Life Sciences, and Human Memory | User | malvern-online.com
text:
New York, NY - On this historic day, the 10th "LOVE ROCKS ART" International Youth Art Exhibition and Ars Longa Award Ceremony took place at the MEMOR Museum in New York. With “memory” as the core theme, this groundbreaking event showcased the transformative power of art and science, offering a platform for young creators to explore the profound connections between history, culture, and life.
Unveiling the Power of Memory
Kristen, the director's assistant of MEMOR Museum, opened the event with a heartfelt speech:“‘Memor’ derives its name from ‘memory.’ The museum’s mission is to preserve and present Asian culture, enabling memories to be both extended and innovated.”
“This is not merely an art exhibition—it’s a journey of exploration into how memory shapes our future. We look forward to deepening our collaboration with the LOVE ROCKS ART Foundation, creating opportunities for young people to connect the past with the future through art and science.”
As a long-standing supporter of the foundation, artist Li Xiaoqiang captivated the audience as host, blending charisma and wit to guide the flow of the event.
Event Highlights
Musical Opening: A Harmony of Memory and Art
The event began with a mesmerizing performance by The Tarumi Violinists, culminating in a solo by Juilliard pre-college cello prodigy Emily Sun. Performing works by Bach and Popper, Sun’s melodies captured the timeless power of memory, deeply resonating with the audience.
Inspiring Speeches: A Fusion of Art, Science, and Education
Prominent speakers shared insights on the intersection of art, science, and education:
Dr. Mao Ye Ji, Senior Bioscientist, and CEO of CSHA : Explored how cross-disciplinary education fosters originality in the AI era.
Ms. Long Yin, Senior Financial Investor, Art Collector, and Board Member of the New Jersey Symphony Orchestra : Advocated for flexible capital as a driver of young artists’ creativity.
AI Artist & Writer Binghe : Demonstrated real-time AI applications in art, illustrating technology’s ability to expand creative boundaries.
Curator Xie Fei, International Curator, and Deputy Director of Yunnan Contemporary Art Museum : Emphasized the role of museums in bridging memory and the future, providing fertile ground for young artists to dream and create.
Speech by Ms. Shang Shuhan: 10 Years of LOVE ROCKS ART
In her keynote address, Ms. Shang Shuhan, founder of The Lady’s Salon: Collectors’ Club and initiator of the LOVE ROCKS ART Foundation, reflected on the decade-long journey of the initiative:
“The combination of art and science is not only about exploring the origins of life but also about creating opportunities for young people to understand the world and shape the future. Through art and technology, we aspire to build a bridge connecting the past and future for the next generation.”
Ars Longa Award Ceremony: Honoring Excellence
The Ars Longa Award Ceremony was the highlight of the event, celebrating the creativity and innovation of young artists worldwide.
Key Awards: Honorary Grand Prize: Lou Chuheng, named as a 2025 co-founder.Gold Medalists: Isabel He (UK), Yian Wang (Beijing), and Sybil Williams (UK). Their works offered profound reflections on memory and the future.
Additional Winners:Young talents from the US, Canada, Australia, Beijing, and Hong Kong showcased exceptional artistic visions, enriching the global art landscape. Notable contributors included:
Sybil Williams (London) and Jordan Lau (Hong Kong), whose visual projects delved into humanity’s relationship with the environment.
Annabell Pu (Royal College of Art) and Shi (Fashion Institute of Technology), whose avant-garde works redefined the exploration of memory and the future.
Sky Gallery & Art Center’s distinguished artworks have been celebrated with prestigious awards.
Looking Ahead: Art, Technology, and Education
Kristen closed the event by expressing optimism for the future:“Today, we witnessed the transformative power of memory. Through our collaboration with the LOVE ROCKS ART Foundation, we hope to inspire more young artists to craft a new chapter where art and technology work together to shape the future of memory.”
The event concluded with a collective vision of fostering creativity and innovation among young artists, ensuring that art and science remain vital forces in shaping a brighter tomorrow.
Foundation Team and Key Roles
The achievements of the LOVE ROCKS ART Foundation are driven by a dedicated team:
Lifetime Scientific Advisor: Dr. Mao Ye Ji
Honorary Advisor for Art Finance: Ms. Long Yin
Founders: Kelly Li, Lemon Li, Amy Li
Co-Founders: Loli Gai, Chuheng Lou, Caden Wang
Foundation Directors: Lin Peirong, Liu Yang
Artistic Director: Mr. Jian Shu Song
Art Management: Xu Junjie
Art Management and Collaborative Youth Artist: Zhou Le
Collaborating Artists: Annabell Pu, Yingjie Shi
Technology and Arts Innovation Officer: Xin Lu
Their collective efforts continue to drive impactful projects that connect individuals through the transformative power of art and science.
Media Contact
Company Name: Loverocksart Foundation Inc
Contact Person: Summer
Email: Send Email
Country: United States
Website: www.loverocksart.com

author: Other News
title: Pearl Valley, Guggisberg take top spots at World Cheese Contest
text: MADISON, Wisc. — Two local cheesemakers took top spots at the 35th biennial World Championship Cheese Contest, held March 5-7 in Wisconsin. Pearl Valley Cheese, of Fresno, Ohio, took first and second place in the Rindless Style Swiss Cheese category with its Swiss cheese, with a score of 98.5 and 98.2, respectively. Guggisberg Cheese’s Ziller was awarded the top two spots in the Baby Swiss category, taking first with a score of 99.4, as well as second place with a score of 98.25. Guggisberg Cheese is based in Sugarcreek, Ohio. Ziller was also named a top 20 finalist for the World Champion Cheese title. Guggisberg Smoked Swiss also received first place in the Open Smoked Hard Cheeses category with a score of 99.45, and was in the final round of top-100 cheeses. Pearl Valley is still located in the tiny northeast corner of Coshocton County known as Pearl where Ernest and Gertrude Stalder began making cheese in a single copper kettle in 1928. The family’s second generation of cheesemakers was led by John and Grace Stalder, who remain a strong presence, led the company from the 1960’s to the 1990’s. In the 1990’s, John and Grace’s son-in-law and daughter, Chuck and Sally Ellis along, with many other sibling family members grew the company. Guggisberg Cheese was founded in 1950 in Millersburg, Ohio, by Swiss immigrant Alfred Guggisberg, who would later develop a new style of Swiss cheese called Baby Swiss with smaller holes and a creamier taste. Alfred’s son Richard took over leadership of the company in 1985 and purchased a new facility in Sugarcreek, Ohio. The contest. The World Championship Cheese Contest is the world’s largest technical cheese, butter and yogurt competition, hosted by the Wisconsin Cheesemakers Association. The contest takes place every other year, alternating annually with the U.S. Cheese Championship. Entries are divided into classes and then judged on a scale ranging from one to one hundred by some of the field’s finest professors. The top three scores in each category are recognized for their excellence, with the top spot receiving the title of World Champion. This year, more than 400 dairy manufacturers from 25 countries and 32 American states, submitted over 3,300 entries in 85 different judging classes to vie for the title of World Champion. This year’s judging panel consisted of international industry experts from all over the world, whose professions include cheese graders, cheese buyers, dairy science professors and researchers. An international panel of expert dairy judges evaluated the entries based on appearance, texture, consistency, eye formation, and of course, flavor. For more information, visit www.worldchampioncheese.org. STAY INFORMED. SIGN UP! Up-to-date agriculture news in your inbox!

author: Fabio Lucas Carvalho
title: Meet the Indian electric mini tractor - 15 HP power, designed for small and medium-sized farms
text:
India's new electric mini tractor offers 15 HP of power and efficiency for small and medium farmers. Discover its advantages.
Modern agriculture faces increasing challenges related to efficiency, sustainability and cost reduction. In this scenario, the Sukoon Haldhar Micro Trac 750, a mini electric tractor innovative with power equivalent to 15 HP, which could be a revolutionary solution for small and medium-sized farms.
Designed to offer high performance, low operating costs and reduced environmental impact, this compact equipment effectively meets the needs of the modern farmer.
Sustainable technology for agriculture and industry
O Haldhar MUT-eV (Multi-Utility Traction EV) is a multifunctional solution designed to address the challenges of agriculture and industry with a sustainable approach.
-
Brazilian agricultural product worth 570 times more than gold production revealed -
This is the new BIGGEST farm in Brazil, impressive for its surprising size, valued at 30 BILLION, has 970 km of roads and could house 10 countries together -
Silvio Santos had a COLOSSAL farm with more than 10 THOUSAND head of cattle that he never set foot on! Get to know the rural side of the greatest presenter in the history of Brazilian TV -
Agritechs revolutionize agribusiness in the interior of São Paulo and show exponential growth
Equipped with advanced electrical technology, the electric mini tractor drastically reduces dependence on fossil fuels, contributing to the reduction of carbon emissions and promoting more responsible environmental practices.
Power and autonomy for everyday life
With a 9,6 kW battery, the Haldhar MUT-eV offers enough power to operate a variety of agricultural implements.
Its autonomy varies between 4 to 6 hours per charge, meeting the main daily demands of small and medium-sized farms.
Additionally, compatibility with fast chargers and systems of solar charging allows operations in remote regions, providing greater flexibility to rural producers.
Compact and functional design
With dimensions of 1.981 mm long, 938 mm wide and 1.193 mm high, the Haldhar MUT-eV is compact enough to maneuver in tight spaces such as uneven terrain and dense crops.
Your weight 490kg and ability to 300 kg lift make it a versatile tool for tasks such as plowing, planting and transporting materials.
Environmental and economic benefits
The main benefits of Haldhar MUT-eV include:
- Zero emission of polluting gases, contributing to a cleaner environment.
- Silent operation, minimizing the noise impact on rural activities.
- Reduction of operating costs by up to 50% in five years, due to the absence of fuel and reduced need for maintenance.
According to studies by the FAO (Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations), the transition to electric agricultural equipment can reduce carbon emissions in agriculture by up to 40%.
Technical specifications
The Haldhar MUT-eV boasts impressive technical specifications, including:
- Maximum speed: 15 km/h
- Ground clearance: 28 cm
- Battery: 160 Ah lead-acid, with expansion option
- Charging Time: 4 to 5 hours with standard plug
- Tires: Front (4,00 x 10) and rear (6,00 x 12)
- Motor voltage: 48V
Compatibility and other details of the mini tractor
Another distinguishing feature of the Haldhar MUT-eV is its compatibility with a variety of implements, such as rotavators, plows and trailers, maximizing its usefulness in different tasks. With the capacity to replace diesel tractors of up to 15 HP, it offers an effective and affordable solution for small farmers.
Designed to withstand harsh conditions, the Haldhar MUT-eV features sealed components that protect against dust, moisture and extreme temperature variations. In addition, it features 2 year warranty on the motor and 3 year warranty on the battery, providing security and confidence to producers.
Integration with systems solar charging enables farmers to adopt a more autonomous and environmentally friendly approach. This is in line with the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), which encourage the adoption of clean and efficient technologies in the agricultural sector.
Future perspectives
The growing demand for sustainable solutions in agriculture suggests that the Haldhar MUT-eV will play a key role in the future of the sector. Advances in energy storage and fast charging are expected to further increase its efficiency and adoption by farmers.
The Sukoon Haldhar Micro Trac 750 is an innovative solution that combines efficiency, economy and sustainability.
With its advanced technology, compact design and attractive cost-benefit, it represents an excellent alternative for producers looking to modernize their operations in an environmentally responsible way.
For more information on how to purchase the Haldhar MUT-eV and transform your farming operations, contact authorized distributors or visit the manufacturer’s official website.
With information Sukoon.
